author: Ryan Haas
title: Satmar Grand Rabbi Calls for More Prayer in Light of Israeli Violence
text:
Share 
The Satmar grand rabbi called for more daily prayer on Thursday in light of violent outbreaks in Israel. 
Despite being one of the leaders of the anti-Zionist movement, the Satmar Grand Rabbi Aaron Teitelbaum called upon his followers to keep in their thoughts and prayers the Jews in Israel, who are currently living in danger and fear. 
Rabbi Teitelbaum is widely known as someone who attends public events that his congregation holds and speaks out against the state of Israel whenever a political discussion arises. 
Most recently, Teitelbaum attended this summer’s anniversary of the death of Satmar Rabbi Joel Teitelbaum, the founder of the Satmar movement in the United States, during which the Iran nuclear deal was a huge topic for discussion. Rabbi Teitelbaum condemned Israel Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu for attacking President Barack Obama during the prime minister’s speech to Congress. 
Last year prior to the Gaza war, three youths were kidnapped and murdered by Arab terrorists. The rabbi followed the tragic news by questioning how much blame can be placed on the parents for sending their children away to study in the first place. 
Despite this, he sticks by the same principal in which the first Satmar Rabbi Joel practiced: prayer. 
When there is prevalent danger of Jewish individuals in Israel, the community must come and pray for their safety.
